issue.title: [R] [Docs] Improve (or really actually document) our Python bridge documentation
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-17526](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-17526). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
https://twitter.com/jonkeane/status/1560016227824721920?s=20&t=g2MhdOOJbh0q0MpxPI4R_Q

When I wrote this, I wished there was a one-page I could show passing a table or recordbatchreader back and forth. https://arrow.apache.org/cookbook/r/using-pyarrow-from-r.html#introduction-4 also has some details, but is more focused on scalars and arrays than tables.

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-17526?focusedCommentId=17584896) by Nicola Crane (thisisnic):*
`[~jonkeane]` Mind opening a cookbook issue too?  We can just swap out the scalar/array content for tables as it's a much more compelling use case.
